abstract: Oracle‘s $3.3 billion acquisition of Hyperion Solutions, announced March 1, is turning out to be a very sweet deal for some company insiders. The announcement that Oracle would pay $52 dollar a share for the Santa Clara-based maker of business intelligence software, a big premium over the $42.84 the stock had closed at the previous day, caused Hyperion’s stock to jump 20.4 percent to $51.57 by the close of the market.
lead_paragraph: Oracle‘s $3.3 billion acquisition of Hyperion Solutions, announced March 1, is turning out to be a very sweet deal for some company insiders. The announcement that Oracle would pay $52 dollar a share for the Santa Clara-based maker of business intelligence software, a big premium over the $42.84 the stock had closed at the previous day, caused Hyperion’s stock to jump 20.4 percent to $51.57 by the close of the market.

headline.main: Timing Is Everything for Hyperion Insiders
